Comment: Larsen's opening, also called Queen's fianchetto opening. The idea is to prepare for a fianchetto of the queen's bishop which will attack throught the long diagonal b2-f6, This was the first time I've encountered such a strange opening.
Limiting the influence of the would-be finachettoed bishop and attempting to control the center, also d5 or c5 were both possible
